summary: Creates an alternate (but identical) set of daggers so two daggers of the same base type (Iron, Elven, Glass, Etc) can be hotkeyed to specific hands simultaneously.
descriptionHtml:
Skyrim actually has some pretty fantastic Hotkey mods, some of the better of which allow you to hotkey weapons to specifc hands (simultaneously or otherwise). But if you're like me (and I know *I* am), a dual-wielding dagger aficionado, you've noticed an annoying limitation: you cannot hotkey two daggers of the same base type. For example, let's say I have two basic Elven Daggers. I cannot set up a hotkey to bind one to the right hand and one to the left. This is also true with a basic Elven Dagger and a Tempered/Enchanted Elven Dagger (even if renamed). This is because, to the game, they're all just "Elven Dagger" and there's just no way (even with SKSE) for a mod to reliably differentiate between them. That's what this mod is about: a workaround to allow you to reliably simultaneously bind two daggers of the same type to whichever hand you want.

So, what EXACTLY does this do?
This creates an alternate version of each of the generic/craftable daggers. It has an asterisk after its name, but is otherwise identical in every way. You obtain it by taking the basic version to a Blacksmith Forge. You'll see "Dagger Name*" in the crafting list (only visible if you have the base dagger), and the only required ingredient is the basic dagger. So, using the Elven Dagger as an example, you obtain two Elven Daggers and go to the Blacksmith Forge and convert one of them to "Elven Dagger*". Now you have an "Elven Dagger" and an "Elven Dagger*", two distinct daggers the game can distinguish between. You can temper and/or enchant either, and then you can (with a suitable mod - I suggest [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/37006]"Dual Hand Combo Hotkeys"[/url]; [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/23416]"More Hotkeys Please"[/url] is also good, but outdated with some flaws) bind each one to a specific hand. Note that you can't convert a "Dagger Name*" back into the base "Dagger Name". I considered it, but that would make it a cheat, since you could go back and forth earning smithing experience.

There are a few versions available:
DualWieldDaggerPairsHK_DLC
-use this version if you have Dawnguard and Dragonborn

DualWieldDaggerPairsHK
-version with no DLC support

DualWieldDaggerPairsHK_DG
-use with DualWieldDaggerPairsHK, if you have Dawnguard but not Dragonborn

DualWieldDaggerPairsHK_DB
-use with DualWieldDaggerPairsHK, if you have Dragonborn but not Dawnguard

DualWieldDaggerPairsHK_DLC_MLDPP
-this one is probably just for me. It's the same as DualWieldDaggerPairsHK_DLC, but compatible with my [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/53209]Morrowloot Daedric++[/url] mod (very niche)


Installation:
Download the appropriate archive (see above), extract to you Skyrim Data folder, and activate the appropriate ESP files from your mod manager. Load order doesn't matter.

P.S. This mod also fixes the oversight that prevented you from being able to improve (temper) your Skyforge Daggers. I figured since you can temper my Alternate version, I might as well fix the original.
author: wavion

files.name: Dual Wield Dagger Pairs DLC MLDPP
